column1: West Gourmet Sandwiches is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Ordered a superfood salad online today for lunch.  Was ready for collection when I arrived and plenty of parking for pick up.  Salad was gorgeous. Massive portion and good quality tasty food. Got an Americano too which was delicious. Will definitely be going back, hidden gem of a place! | Went in at 12 today after recommendation from a friend who'd seen it on social media. Menu was vast and I couldnt really read it because other people were standing infront. Asked my very friendly server what the most popular sandwich was and she informed me the chicken supreme or harissa chicken with goats cheese. I went for the later. It was a taste sensation. My mouth is still watering. Absolutely delightful. Will definitely return. | I'm in Belfast for a few days and was recommended West's yesterday for lunch.  I got their special (no photo unfortunately) and it was absolutely fantastic. So much so IV gone back today and got the same sandwich, but in a baguette (yesterday's was in focaccia).  The staff are super friendly and the sandwiches are full to the brim!!  I will be going back tomorrow (if time allows).  If you're coming to Belfast and looking for a well priced lunch, that's going to keep you full until dinner, I can not recommend West's enough. | Me & my partner ordered from here for our little ones Gender Reveal and we're absolutely over the moon with the buffet we chose. We went for Menu B and opted for the satay chicken instead of the sausage rolls. Absolutely gorgeous! We had about 40 people attend and they all said how delicious and well presented it was! We will definitely use here for all our future functions! A big thank you to all of the team, from the lady who helped us book, to the kitchen and delivery guy! Thanks Joe & Bekah | We chose West to cater for a family birthday party at home. From the point of ordering the staff were extremely helpful and on the evening the food arrived bang on time. West provided an absolutely delicious and varied selection of sandwiches, wraps, mini burgers, sausages, chicken gougons, chicken skewers and vegetarian options. Highly recommend and will use again.

Common Market is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: The place was a bit underwhelming. Loads of vendors were closed even though we were comfortably eating and drinking within the opening hours.  Food was fine (looked better than it tasted) but the bar was really really slow!  The place felt a bit lifeless and so I wouldnGÇÖt bother returning | Absolutely loved it here, lots of different food stalls so loads of choice on what to eat, I opted for the tacoGÇÖs from SicarioGÇÖs, which were huge and really tasty. The only downside in my opinion is there arenGÇÖt enough bars inside which means you can queue for a while. Great atmosphere inside and really good vibe around the place, well worth a visit! | We had so much fun here Great selection of food Plenty of seating Good location  Already looking forward to the next busy | Gorgeous food market. Would definitely recommend when in Belfast. Loads of food options for everyone. Fantastic musician/guitarist performing when we were there too.  I opted for the Mexican place and got a beef birria rice bowl which was very filling and very tasty.  Only downside is drinks only available at the bar. Could definitely do with having non alcoholic drinks like water at the stalls themselves so that you donGÇÖt have to join a long queue of people getting beers and cocktails for a cup of water. | While the entry fee is only -ú1, the state of the facilities is completely unacceptable. I headed to the restrooms immediately upon arrival and was horrified to find extensive mold and exposed, live electrical wires. Due to broken lighting, two stalls were in pitch blackness. While I understand venues struggle with upkeep, these are serious safety hazards. The overall cleanliness was so poor that I felt compelled to leave immediately. I cannot recommend this venue until they address these basic hygiene and safety standards.

The Burrito Bar is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Delicious food, lonely atmosphere, will be comming back here again. | Called in yesterday, amazing food and staff were extremely welcoming. Will definitely be back | I eat a lot of burritos, has there a great healthy food to eat while youGÇÖre on the move. This was one of the best burritos IGÇÖve ever had in Ireland. Thank you! | Loved it got a burrito with shredded beef and the full works not one complaint I think it might be my new regular go to takeaway | I love the burrito usually but tonight it was dry hardly any sour cream or cheese sauce on it very miserable hardly any onions or peppers was very disappointed very dry

Bright's Restaurant is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: This place is not fancy - more of a diner style cafe - but the large breakfast fry was excellent and the service was friendly. They missed an egg off my portion and it came within 30 seconds, once I had alerted the waitperson. The coffee was fine, although the cappuccino came without chocolate on top. | The smoked cod was interesting, I liked it but it was just a bit on the salty side. The peas were soggy unfortunately. Very healthy portions though. Decent prices for what youGÇÖre getting. Staff were lovely and attentive even though it was quite busy. The place itself is nothing fancy, but itGÇÖs clean and tidy, and wasnGÇÖt loud even though it was busy and music was playing. Not sure IGÇÖd come back, but it was nice enough. | Honestly just had my worst meal IGÇÖve ever had in Belfast. Fish and chips, shouldnGÇÖt be that hard but wow did they mess it up. Came in two tiny slices, completely burnt and hardly any fish. It was straight up eating bread and batter. It was disappointing and disgusting. I had two bites and just sat there eating the chips. My partner ordered the chili chicken and he said it was just fine, didnGÇÖt fee well 45 min later. Too many places here, this was a big waste of money and time. Disgusting. | Nice enough place. They didnGÇÖt have enough cod for all 5 of us to have fish and chips which was odd but that happens. Nice enough food. -ú20 for fish and chips seems a little OTT for a basic cafe but itGÇÖs not ridiculous prices. Not one to go out your way for but if the Northern Whig wonGÇÖt let you in cos your wearing trainers then take your parties. -ú120 to them. The staff were very friendly. | Always get great honest home cooked meals here. Great selection and great chips. Went for the Christmas chips, best around in my opinion

Wok A Moley is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: The Best Salted Chilly Chicken & Curry Sauce in Town..This place is very popular among crowds after club or night out. The food is very tasty and fresh as always, never had any issue. I always order from here and never disappoint. | Food was over priced, didnGÇÖt get a proper portion size for the price that was paid, disguised, foods not warm had to be heated in microwave no flavour, never order from here again. Chicken is Pink. Was for a resident in my care home and now scared incase something happens to them eating pink chicken | Ordered a delivery, delays for about an hour, then when I rang they said my order was on its way. Nope, marked as delivered but nothing came, absolute disgrace. Do not order from this poorly managed restaurant. | Found boss man's nail clippings in my food which caused me to chip my tooth. In response I brought a shopping trolley inside with my friend in it to attack boss for his actions. However no success was made in taking down this disgusting establishment. | As a half and half Chinese Mexican immigrant myself this fusion between Chinese and Mexican food was right up my street! My good friend aayush has been ranting and raving about this place, to be honest he always smells really yummy. Like curry. I hypothesised this was because of the food here. However he must just be taking curry baths because the food did not taste nearly as good as he smells. I did however enjoy the abundance of bossmanGÇÖs toenails in my food. Will be back to stalk handsome brown boys.

Boojum - Botanic Avenue is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: One of the best burritos you'll get. They can be a bit stingy with the meat filling. I've also found the pork has lost its flavour over time. Expect to queue when you go - not because they are short staffed but because it's so popular. | Quick service, good quality, reasonable price and good value. But the only toilet has a broken handle and the music is too loud, hard to hold a conversation, please turn it down and call a plumber for extra =ƒîƒ | Staff to worried about pivk ups and not us customers who walk to this shop to be treated horrible by staff. Chicken was cold and said had no pinto beans when after serving me a takeaway order got them. Completely let down by this visit will not be back and will be telling everyone of my friends and family and Facebook people about how rude there staff have become. | Staff need an attitude check to be honest, especially the larger man who wears a beard net and the skinny guy who does the sauces.  I donGÇÖt get any beans or vegetables in my bowl so I always ask for extra rice, it usually isnGÇÖt an issue any other time IGÇÖve been in however the larger man told me heGÇÖd put it on at the end? IGÇÖm assuming he probably thoughts IGÇÖd just forget about itGÇª  When it came to actually getting my extra rice the skinnier guy pointed to it and said GÇ£you wonGÇÖt get much more in that mateGÇ¥ basically saying no extra, which just made things extremely awkward and most people would just drop it there but when youGÇÖre charging 13 quid for a burrito bowl you can bet that I will get what IGÇÖm paying for.  NEVER had an issue like this before and I understand that you guys were busy at the time but a bit of respect goes a long way. Also no manners whatsoever and rushing everyone through their orders is just nasty.  IGÇÖll be going to great Victoria street from now on never had a problem there | The tacos were swimming in liquid and were not very pleasant. Also, the chicken consisted of tiny bits of dark, shrivelled meat. I contacted Boojum and they did not respond.

39 Gordon Street is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Went to a drink and draw night here with a friend and it was so much fun, I don't think we interacted with the permanent staff only the staff that were running the drink and draw but they were all super lovely and really hosted a great evening | Good music.  CouldnGÇÖt quite comment on the price of drink though.  Friendly staff.  A bit quick to lift glasses of drink off an unoccupied table - whilst people are dancing.  Can be difficult to get served at the bar and limited seating.  Toilets surprisingly clean for such a busy place on a Saturday night | My first time being in 39 Gordon street and I loved it. The atmosphere was fantastic staff friendly and the music was brilliant. It was live singers and they were amazing will definitely be back =ƒÿü | I worked a drink and draw at this venue in their outside area and it was really lovely, great people, staff were polite and everyone attending the event loved the location, I would visit again just to relax and have a drink | nice bar in the city centre

The Spaniard is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: The lady who served my Guinness didn't let it sit, and then wipe the head off with it with a knife.... Gf accepted it. Good service, Clean, Music, it's a nice pub. | The Comedy night with James have been amazing fun.  James Downey is a great host and fun comedian. I enjoyed the evening ( Craig the ging) even i didnt understand all the jokes. Staff at the bar was friendly and drinks avordable. | This bar used to be one of my favorites but the level of service has seriously went downhill. The girl that served us tonight was rude and totally incompetent. When we asked for drink it was a major hassle. Then when we went out for a cigarette a came back ahead had binned all our drinks. | Nice little bar whether you are upstairs or downstairs. Downstairs is brighter and the upstairs is a little more cozy and fun decor filled with images of the sacred heart plus some random dressy dogs.  The pina coladas are surprisingly delicious. | Lovely bar. But the attitude of Santa Claus bouncer needs to improve. Everyone was ready to leave and just singing the last played song in the bar, but he was very aggressive asking people to leave. We pointed out it was 5mins to closure time as a bit of banter to say "we're gonna leave after this" and he got very confrontational telling us to leave immediately.

Stereo is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Wow! We have been trying to get to Stereo from it opened after seeing the food photos on the socials. Today we arrived. From the moment you enter the customer service is exceptional and staff are passionate about their jobs and the food they sell encouraging us to try the Hash Browns. I had the Potato and Chorizo and the wife had the special, the BLT. We had to have side portions of hash browns and black pudding too. With a constant top up of water through out I wish they had a tasting menu to allow us a little of everything. Thank you for a brilliant experience. | The coffee and food was amazing. I had a strawberry and cream waffle with an oat latte. My partner had a hot chocolate with the breakfast sandwich. The servers were really nice and friendly. It took us a while to visit this place because there's usually a long queue but we got lucky and went on a week day and it was lovely. Would definitely go again but only on a week day. I voted the atmosphere as 4/5 because the only comfy seats there are the booth seats by the wall. | Go here if you can! Food was amazing and the coffee was fantastic. The service was awesome as well. We were passing through Belfast and stopped just on chance and we are so glad we did! Definitely a highlight to our Northern Ireland trip! | Absolutely amazing food, went for brunch and left very full and very happy. The guy who owns the place was lovely and friendly but also very knowledgeable about his food and the fancy filter coffee, it's so refreshing to eat somewhere that doesn't just sell boring fry ups! I particularly like the fact that as soon as you are seated they bring you some water!  I had the corn hummus on sourdough which came with poached eggs and I added sausages and it was fantastic, whatever they soak the tomatoes in was so good, even the sausages had a wee kick to them and my eggs were perfectly poached!  My hubby had the sliced potato and chorizo with crispy fried eggs and it was a lot of eating, he said it was the best brunch he'd had in a long time, they even make their own chorizo with pork mince nuts and spices it's a deconstructed version so none of those crap chorizo sausage slices.  You have to check this place out! My only complaint is that my cappuccino wasn't big enough =ƒÿå honestly though you must try this place! | Genuinely used to love this place but haven't been for a while. I came back hoping it would be as good as I remember it but genuinely entirely disappointed. I wasn't greeted at the door but instead called over to from halfway across the shop, where I was entirely misheard. Instead of coming over to clarify, the conversation continued from four metres away while I continue to try and ask if I can sit in. I got the hummus and grilled corn on toast and I was so disappointed the grilled corn was fridge cold and the hummus was for the most part inedible due to the odd texture. I said the hummus was inedible to staff and instead of offering any solution a supervisor told me it's because of the nutritional yeast in the product, which isn't advertised on the menu. Honestly really disappointed as I wanted to continue loving Stereo but after this experience I cannot recommend it

Haptik is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Visited here this morning with my wife. Our first time at Haptik, and have to say it was really excellent. Service was top notch and food was so delicious. Coffee was great as well. I had the Huevos Rancheros and my wife had the Baghdad Eggs. Really really good - would highly recommend. 5 stars G¡Én+Å | Great spot that we never tire of! Food is always fantastic and my iced latte hit the spot on a warm day =ƒÿü Breakfast roll and shakshuka! Took no time at all and service is always friendly. | Food is always beautifully presented and so delicious! Lots of choice for vegetarians and they were also happy to replace the meat in the special. Very friendly staff, always glad to come back whenever we're in Newtownards | Yes, I can buy and eat my own flowers for breakfast! Beautiful brunch enjoyed on my first, but imagine it will not be my last, visit to this fantastic cafe in Newtownards. Choosing gluten free cost me my sausages but the dish more than made up for my initial disappointment. Food quality was superb, portion generous and the gluten free bagel was a bonus. Would heartily recommend. Very friendly and helpful servers and I loved the interiors of this place as well. Note: at busy times you may have to wait for tables of four but I was quickly seated as I only needed a table of one. Totally worth a wait though if you ever find that there is one! | All round awesome.  Staff were friendly and attentive, atmosphere was nice and the food was outstanding!!  Mushrooms on toast really inspired me to try new things when cooking at home and my partners waffles were incredible.  We will definitely be back.

Pablos is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Nice Mexican atmosphere, exceptionally friendly server who made us feel welcome and promptly delivered three very large meals. The midweek taco deal at -ú13 was great value given the quality and portion size of food. Also a nice location to sit and watch time go by in the busy shopping area of the city. Hard to see how you could go wrong with pablos given their variety, taste and various deals through the week | Belter of a burger and equally impressive fries. Perfect for the end if a good night. Staff were great sorted us out with seating upstairs when place was busy. 10/10. | The burger was pretty bad. If youGÇÖre gonna insist on well-done bc you lack the kitchen permit or meat quality at least go with a thin smash patty or season properly or something. This was thick, grey and dry. Also room temp bc of the service. V sad bc the bun and toppings were solid. Onion rings were insanely greasy but I was so hungry I ate about 2.5 of em before feeling queasy. The service was really cold, I felt like an intrusion on their vape breaks (which I couldnGÇÖt care less aboutGÇªvape away bro). | Yeah really enjoyed the meal here. Great place for a quick, filling meal during a pub crawl. The vibe is burgers with a South American feel, so you get good tacos and really tasty nacho cheese sauce etc. The margaritas are fantastic too, and they were only a fiver as well. Bustling and busy, and cosy. Great dirty fries, good falafel, great staff. | Best gluten free dirty fries you'll find in all 32 counties!! Gluten free burger is fantastic too, highly recommend GÿåGÿåGÿåGÿåGÿå

El Habanero is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: The food here is absolutely delicious and extremely fresh, my new favourite now being the quesadillas. The service was great and there is a wide variety of options - IGÇÖll definitely be returning for another amazing experience | It was gone too quickly to get a proper photo. Got a quesidilla on the way to the bus stop on a whim as a quick snack.  Pork was so fresh... Melted in the mouth  Guys English wasn't great. But tbh that's a green flag. | Best burrito in Belfast. Staff are very friendly, and all the food tastes great. Every option for burritos is worth it, so well worth the weekly visit. | I bought a Cuban sandwich on Saturday morning. Fresh and so delicious. CanGÇÖt wait to go back and try the burritos. | A highly recommended experience, the food was very good, we loved it. The staff were very friendly. We will definitely be back every time we visit, 10 out of 10 for service. Thank you very much.

Pepe's is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: I had ordered chicken rice meal. Got the chicken rice hot flavour , with soggy fries.  Customer service it would say is poor. I agree to previous reviews they really donGÇÖt seem to be bothered about it.  I got the fries really soft and fried twice as i could feel from the taste. I was so hungry and thought would have PePes peri peri but I was wrong for the choice.  If you order please double check if its fresh.  Have a look at my pictures of fries in the worst condition i have ever had.  This is the second time experience i have had with pepes now. | Previously, I have given a 1 star for this review due to the behaviour of the old staff. But today, I have revisited the place, and I was greeted with new faces. The new staff are friendly and professional. They maintained cleanliness and often come upstair to clean and pick up the leftover/trash even when the condition is a bit busy for them. An excellent change of atmosphere, I really hope the new staff are not a temporary thing and the condition can be maintained. The foods are as tasty as other pepe's branches. Good management choice. | DonGÇÖt try this place the food is stink if u donGÇÖt want to play with ur health donGÇÖt eat from here .. | Pepe Restaurant serves some of the best chicken, and their unique spices make the flavour stand out. The food is consistently tasty, and you can really notice the quality in every bite. Overall, a great place to enjoy well-seasoned chicken and a satisfying meal. | Very slow service. The food wasn't very good. The paneer loaded rice had so much salt in it, it was inedible. I've eaten in lots of Pepe's branches all over the UK and never come across so bad.

Flout! is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: I came here recently during lunch time. Had heard some amazing reviews, hence thought to give it a go.  The queue was alright. Ordered 4 different types of pizza slices,. The service was fast and staffs were very friendly.  I found the pizza's taste to be average. The base was very hard and tough to chew and felt the pizzas were too salty. The taste didn't meet up to the hype. | So, I went here with my wife and 3 year old son on a whim knowing it's always busy, with no expectations of getting in. Luckily we walked right up and got served by the most hospitable guy with a beard. When I told him I had never been before, he kindly talked me through how it all worked, what each dish was and made us feel very welcome. He also offered to exchange any food order we didn't like, which was a really nice touch for customer service. Honestly, it was a short but sweet interaction that made us feel welcome and appreciated - this makes all the difference in the world.  Of course we did not need to exchange any slices we ordered as they were all absolutely incredible. The pepperoni and Vodka Sausage were both fantastic. Would highly recommend both. My son had a classic slice of Margherita and he ate most of it without complaint (was slightly too big for him, but I gladly helped him finish the portion).  Will 100% come back on account of both food and service. As it is a bit more expensive than its competitors, the service really tipped the scales on whether or not I'd return. The pizza is top quality, but it's the service that made the whole thing exceptional. | Was excited to try this place after seeing plenty of videos on social media.  It did not disappoint, next level pizza. Crusty base, all homemade fresh ingredients including flour.  Really really tasty. | I really like the concept of this place (different varieties of pizza and by the slice), but the pizza didn't wow me unfortunately. It was quite good and I enjoyed the more interesting toppings available (like the sprout one!) but to me, nothing super special considering the huge line out the door. | Pizza was good i tried three slices, one of which was a spicy meat and it was lovely and definitely very filling but the waiting times are a bit mad as the slices are re-heated which slows the que alot..also tried the ranch but dont recommend as I found it had no taste whatsoever. They ask if you want extra toppings which included hot honey, basil and some sort of cottage cheese which I got and they all went well together =ƒæî

Sicarios is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Really good tacos packed with flavour but was a hefty -ú27 for the two dishes, I think a few added salsas/guacamoles in a pot on the side then it would be justified | Ordered here today, first of all what is up with your staff. So impolite. Second of all, to charge 16 quid for a burrito that has about as much flavour as a boiled spud is something. No spice, no salsa, no sour cream, actually had to double check this wasnGÇÖt a frozen burrito from Iceland.. Paid an extra 3 quid for guac but sure they didnGÇÖt wack it in, not sure it would have done much for flavour anyway. Had to open it up to have a nosey, and yes confirmed all dry no flavour a lovely 20 quid spent. | ShouldGÇÖve realised when we arrived and there wasnGÇÖt a single person in the queue that it was best avoided. The staff were absolutely miserable GÇö not an ounce of customer service. It was genuinely awkward ordering, as they didnGÇÖt say a single word, not even a simple hello. The food is extortionately priced for what you get: dry, tasteless, and completely lacking in flavour. To be fair, it looks appealing, but thatGÇÖs about as far as it goes. Definitely wouldnGÇÖt return, and I wouldnGÇÖt recommend anyone else waste their time or money here. | The person who served me kept vaping while working at the stall... gross.  The food tasted okay, super expensive, but it made me feel a bit sick about 6 hours after eating there.  Hygiene was definitely an issue, and on previous visits to the market, the staff was rude and smelled like alcohol. | Never usually write reviews but feel I must after an awful food experience yesterday (Sat 22 Nov 2025). I ordered tacos and I got a soggy cold salty mess on a plate. I am convinced they had been lying around for a while and reheated. Unfortunately in contradiction to my better judgement, I ate them. I am have regretted that decision every minute since. I will now actively avoid this food outlet and strongly recommend everyone else does the same.

Taquitos is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: IGÇÖm so glad that the Boss still serves me as I come at the very second it halfway closing. The all time classic burrito is nothing I have tasted before. Fresh ingredients and is very unique with its secret sauce. The chicken inside is real juicy. They outdelivrted my expectation. Its premium pricing is justified. | Incredibly good tasting food, best chips of my life. Really good lads to talk to as well, great stories of where the food has come from. Insanely good chips honestly, crispy as and so fluffy, tacos and Garybox was incredible, really good food and fills you so much | Fabulous food and incredibly friendly and informative service! All gluten free made it a super treat! WeGÇÖll be back. Maybe today. | Stopped on way to the Belfast giants. Unbelievably tasty, the 2 gents running it were hilarious and very friendly & the tacos and nachos amazing.  Will be back for more. An artist behind the grill and can taste love in his food!! | First time trying birria tacos - my life is changed for the better=ƒñ» I mean holy shit look at the photos, this was a cathartic experience  The men that run the van are absolutely lovely too!

Munch Belfast is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Was in Belfast for the day for Boundary jubilee festival at the Portview trade centre. This came highly recommended  Two of us had the full Irish breakfast and one a burger. We all had coffees. The food set us up for the day. Would I go back ? 100%. They even serve beer. Think I saw one lad drinking a pint of Guinness. | Visited yesterday and I would highly recommend! Super friendly staff and quality food, the eggs benedict with a choice of salmon or bacon were on point, absolutely delicious! I opted for the salmon. | We visited from Alabama USA and had Munch on our list for a Full Irish Breakfast and did we get a Breakfast.  The wait staff is wonderful in the kind service we received unlike many places in the US. They treated my wife and I as if they had known us forever. Now,  the Breakfast was unreal. I am a big man at 6'4 and 235lbs and no way I could eat all on my plate although I wanted to devour every bite. I recommend that you visit if you plan a trip to Belfast. You will not be sorry and make sure you are hungry.  Thank you to all at Munch. You gave us a experience to remember. | Food 10/10- service 10 /10 - atmosphere 10/10  Munch is one of my favourite places in Belfast for breakfast. ThereGÇÖs a huge selection, and breakfast is available all day. The quality of the ingredients is excellent. At weekends the place can get busy, but itGÇÖs worth the wait. The atmosphere is great, the staff are very friendly, and the food is very well priced. Highly recommend this place. | What a wonderful find after a chaotic morning of travelling. Huge menu selection, very reasonably priced and great portion sizes. A hidden gem for sure, Charlene and the girls are a credit to your team and go above and beyond to cater to everyone's needs. Will definitely be back the next time I'm across the pond!

Bootleggers is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Very tasty burgers, I had the one with fired Camembert. It was delicious! And not to mention the sweet potato fries sent me to heaven. Warmly recommend this place. Book upfront! I was alone and they made exception to accommodate me on one bar table. | Best bar ever in Belfast!! Sooo so nice, OMG that burgers!!! Like heaven=ƒÿï beautiful...and the Blue moon beer! All the staff are very friendly, very cool place. So big american style bar, very spacious, cosy. Highly recommend!=ƒÿì | Good and service was so gooood!! Wanted all the foodGÇª ended up ordering too much though because it all looked & sounded so good. Highly recommend their nachos and chicken wings!! | Amazing food , The Plain Jane burger was one of the best I have had. The music and atmosphere were fantastic. I Would highly recommend! | The staff extremly welcoming and kind. Food is amazing. Best burgers and fries =ƒññ=ƒÿü

The Burger Club is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Lovely friendly, modern restaurant. Food was amazing especially the loaded fries. Service was great, fast and polite. I would highly recommend this little gem everyone. | I rarely write reviews but we had the best food tonight at The Burger Club Belfast. It was my sonGÇÖs 13th birthday and they kindly let us share a surprise video message from his friends on their big tv screen. My son said it the food was 10/10GÇª the best cheese burger he had ever tasted. We shared starters of peppered chicken with tobacco onions and peppered sauce on chips and chicken wings smothered in Franks hot sauce. I had the peppered buttermilk chicken burger. Was perfection too. If only you could taste it from the photos. | Came in for some lunch. The burger and chips were fantastic. Presentation was great and the food didnGÇÖt take so long. The young waitress was very sweet and polite however there was an older woman who was a bit more bull than lady. Maybe a bad day? Probably more of a bad life. She might need to settle it down. Other than that angry grey cloud of a woman it was a nice feed. | Great little spot! Burgers were first class, as we're the goujons. I got the Christmas applewood smoked burger and loved it (a word of warning, the goujons come with chips. I didn't know that and was quickly stuffed!). I tried the mozzarella sticks and peppered loaded chips too and they were very tasty. All washed down with a biscoff milkshake. 10/10 will be back!! We booked a table and it was quiet when we arrived but got busy real quick so I'd recommend reserving if you're going around dinner time. | Great fast food burger joint that has the nicest burgers with a great menu choice. I love the Korean sticky chicken burger always my go to. Great section of dips to go with succulent chicken wings and loaded chips. Full bar licence which serves cracker selction of ales an Madri on draught perfect all rounder that goes down nicely with a great burger. I always sit in but you can do takeaway an they deliver.

Stran-wiches is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: First time trying Stran-wiches today. My friend and I went at lunchtime for takeaway and were served immediately by a very pleasant member of staff. The music in the shop when we arrived was very loud, but a member of staff must have thought so too, and quickly turned it down a bit. I ordered the Reuben with pastrami, cheese, pickles, sauerkraut and mustard, and my friend ordered the Mexican chicken on a wrap. We waited less than 10 minutes until our order was ready, and we were able to pay separately using both cash and card payments.  Now, onto the sandwich itself. I personally didn't feel that it was worth -ú12 for the size of my Reuben, and at -ú11, my friends' wrap was even smaller still. My foccacia was quite dry, and I'd have loved either a dipping sauce or even a little bit of mayo in addition to the mustard. There was SO much sauerkraut that I couldn't taste the cheese at all. I love sauerkraut and pickles in general, but to have so much on there that it overpowered everything else was really disappointing. The flavour profile was just really unbalanced for my taste, though the pastrami when I tried it by itself, was thinly sliced and super tasty.  Now, onto the reason for the low rating. Most deli's will wrap a sandwich in paper, slice it in half, and THEN wrap it in foil. At Stran-wiches, they wrap it in the paper and foil and then slice it which means that when I went to eat my Reuben, I kept finding tiny bits of foil throughout the first few bites closest to where it had been cut. I found this really off-putting because it effectively forced me to use my fingers to dig through my sandwich to remove them, which on an airated bread like foccacia wasn't easy!! Such a silly mistake to make, but it significantly affected my enjoyment of my lunch, and my first impression of this place.  My friends opinion of her Mexican Chicken wrap was that everything was fresh and the texture of the wrap was so pleasant, but the sauce was so overpowering that it was all she could taste. After eating her wrap, she was still a bit hungry too, which after spending -ú11 definitely shouldn't be the case.  Overall, I'd probably go back to Stran-wiches and maybe try one of the salad bowls next time but I think, especially on Stranmillis where you have really class places to choose from for lunchtime offerings, it would be way lower down on my list. | IGÇÖve been to stranwiches a good number of times and I have loved it every time. It does depend on the menu whether or not I go and visit but most months you will find something you like or want to try. My favourite will always be the turkey sandwich with pear slices, it sounds weird but it is the perfect combination. I think their sandwich ideas are original and cater towards everyone. As everything is fresh to order and there is always a line you can be waiting for around 15 minutes which seems like a long wait but gives you time to go next door for some traybakes or across the street to the shop and I would say the wait is worth it because the sandwiches are huge and have sometimes done me for lunch and dinner on the day. | Very decent hand made fresh sandwiches/wraps and focaccia, with very interesting fillings and ingredients. Excellent flavour and presentation (with maybe a bit too much filler lettuce?). Certainly a "wee treat" place as apposed to a daily, given the prices. Fair play to the owners to get away with it around Stanmillis, but it seems way above, +c.50% more expensive than other very similar places in Belfast (e.g. Tasty Nosh, Stacked, Thyme, West). Serious hipster tax. | Salmon and cream cheese bagel was lacking in the salmon department considering the price. My colleagues also found their Caesar wraps and turkey club quite disappointing for the price and the wraps were short on meat. Wait time was also a bit on the extreme side. Overall a grand lunch and does the job but really not worth the price. | Stu

Revoluci+¦n de Cuba Belfast is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: We came on a Sunday evening and they had a live band at just the right volume. It's huge and ornate. Great spot and I'll be back just for the cocktails and friendly service   please keep it up, keep the staff and keep hiring well =ƒæì | Great food, friendly staff and lovely ambience. We will definitely return. | We came here for our work's Christmas 'do'. It wasn't our first choices, but we wanted a good night out, and Revoluti+¦n de Cuba looked good - on paper.  The atmosphere was lively, any other night, it would be perfect. Unfortunately, it wasn't ideal for us; far too loud, so loud we couldn't hear what the person, who was sitting next to us, was saying. Usually on a 'work's night out', the ambient music is lower during meal times. I understand this is more of a club scene, and if we were just going to use it as such, it would be fine, and my ratings would reflect this, but as a Christmas meal venue, it did not work for us at this time.  The food came out promptly, as we had pre-ordered that was to be expected, my starter was nice, except I wasn't expecting hot chilli peppers on my prawn cocktail. I suppose that was a Mexican twist on a Christmas classic! My slow cooked beef was chewy and not very warm, but my pudding - banana Eton Mess - was delicious! For the price, I would've expected better.  All in all, as a Christmas meal venue, it did not work. As just a Christmas drinks night out, it would've been ok.

Arriving at 2.30pm, I asked if the kitchen was still open and was told yes by the waiter, who added, "We close at 3." I asked if that gave me enough time to order a salad and was told yes. I asked for the Goat Cheese Salad, which arrived promptly.  The ingredients were fresh and generous, but strangely a large portion of hot onion relish had been dumped on top of the cheese.  It ruined the dish. At that point a few other customers were heading for the door, and I spotted a friend going past with his dog. To which he muttered something under his breath. I couldn't make out what was said, but it was nothing good.  My lunch was half eaten but my plate was removed from my table. The same waiter, I'm not kidding, asked me, "How was everything?". I answered, "It was going OK until you threw me out". He then said, "I didn't ask you to leave." There are some situations in life which are not worth the effort, and this was one of them. I was charged -ú14 for a partial salad and a tea. Won't be back.

Went on Saturday evening for a meal and had called up prior to check some dietary requirements for gluten free items.. I was told a list of items that werenGÇÖt marked could be altered. Upon ordering I informed the server I had called earlier and the item I wanted was agreed to be made to suit, then when she brought the food she set it to me and I knew the bap on the burger wasnGÇÖt gluten free and was told before I even spoke that my meal wasnGÇÖt gluten free as I never requested it.. but I hadnGÇÖt even asked yet if it was definitely suitable for me.. the server knew she hadnGÇÖt noted the requirement when originally informed and had obviously tried to pass it off as my fault.. then told me chips arenGÇÖt suitable either and another server then interrupted and offered to just remove the bap and that chips were definitely ok even though she said thereGÇÖs contamination in the fryer but no one had ever had a problem before with eating them so itGÇÖs ok.. as a coeliac this isnGÇÖt how cross contamination works if itGÇÖs present it will affect the person and the staff need a serious amount of training on this issue if youGÇÖre going to offer the gluten free service.. having the risk as gluten items are in the premises is one thing and different as itGÇÖs expected but to say that even though thereGÇÖs definitely contamination but itGÇÖs ok.. this is wrong and very misleading. The embarrassment came from the servers being loud while discussing the issue with several other tables all looking to see what was going on, wouldnGÇÖt hurry back and couldnGÇÖt wait to leave especially with getting dirty looks from the staff.

the pocket is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: Loved this place!  The food and service was great. My husband ordered the fried chicken waffle, and I had the sourdough with mushrooms and two poached eggs, plus two beef sausages on the side. That was a standout for me. Our daughter had French toast with honey and raspberry jam, and we also ordered her a hot chocolate (not pictured). Everything we ordered was excellent. Tortilla Belfast is a Mexican restaurant in Belfast. Customer reviews say: My first time trying here and I ordered a vegetarian burrito bowl, even though I'm not a strict vegetarian any more. WOW! Buns & Dough is a Mexican restaurant in Cork. Customer reviews say: Went here yesterday evening and we got a take away and was so happy with everything. The Food: They have a standard chipper menu consisting of various types of burgers, pizzas and chips. We ordered the Hawaiian burger and chips with some curry dip on the side. The Idle Hour is a Mexican restaurant in Cork. Customer reviews say: During my stroll through the charming Port of Cork, I stumbled upon a quaint Irish pub that beckoned me inside. Eager to experience a taste of the local culture, I decided to stop in for a refreshing drink. From the moment I entered, the barmaid (server) greeted me with genuine warmth, kindness, and a helpful attitude.  Taking note of my curiosity, she attentively listened to my preferences and offered a wonderful suggestion: Irish apple cider. It happened to be my first time trying cider, and I'm delighted to say it was a delightful choice. The cider was perfectly crafted, striking a harmonious balance between sweetness and crispness that left me longing for another sip.  The pub itself exuded a friendly and inviting atmosphere. Although the bustling bar area was occupied, the cozy coaches offered a serene spot for me to unwind and savor my drink. Immersed in the authentic Irish ambiance, I couldn't help but appreciate the genuine sense of camaraderie and enjoyment that permeated the air.  This impromptu visit to the Irish pub left a lasting impression on me. The attentive and amiable service provided by the barmaid, along with the exceptional Irish apple cider, contributed to a truly memorable experience. I relished every moment, immersing myself in the rich tapestry of Irish tradition and hospitality.  If you find yourself exploring the Port of Cork, I wholeheartedly recommend paying a visit to this charming pub. Whether you're a cider aficionado or simply seeking a genuine taste of Ireland, you'll be treated to a warm welcome, an inviting atmosphere, and a drink that will transport you to good places. | Decent locals bar in the docks area know as 'Jewtown'. KC & Son & Sons is a Mexican restaurant in Cork. Customer reviews say: KC & Son & Sons is a Cork staple! It is definitely worth the drive to Douglas to go stand in the queue down the street from their door way! Their pittas are really worth it!  Staff: The staff are very friendly here. They are also very attentive and get the order right everytime no matter how big your order is.  Food: They have so many choices to choose from here with their Pittas being the main items that they are known for! Some of their best pittas in my own opinion are the King Creole (Chicken), the Philly Steak (Beef) and my personal favourites the Angry Spaniard (Chicken & Chorizo) and the Kansas City Pitta (Pork). The Angry Spaniard is a hot Pitta filled Chips, Mayo, Lettuce and topped off with Chorizo, Chicken and hot sauce! Then the Kansas City Pitta is a hot Pitta filled with Chips, Mayo, Lettuce, sliced gherkin and topped off with slow roasted pork belly that is rubbed with their own blend of spices and coated in a homemade BBQ sauce! Whats not to love! They also serve really tasty burgers and they have the world of side options. These range from chips to Pineapple Fritters to their famous Chicken Bombays. They have these huge bags too if you order a lot of food or if you need to carry your option in one bag. Handy to bring it on a picnic.  Queue: Don't be phased by the queue here as sometimes it could be 10 people long and just inside the premises or 30 people deep outsode of the premises! It does move fast and you won't be waiting any longer than 30 minutes to get inside to make your order.  Layout: The new layout is much more efficient and it goes as follows: You walk up one side of the queuing area inside the premesis and at the top of this side you place your order, then turn at the top and you walk back down the other side towards the doorway and they will have your order prepaired and ready for collection juat as you go out the door!  Overall Recommendation: I highly recommend calling to KC & Son & Sons as its a Cork staple! I always find myself here every couple of weeks and I nearly always find myself going for something different to what I ordered last time! | Very famous family run restaurant which was prevented from closing due to the crowdGÇÖs demand is a must try outlet. Zambrero is a Mexican restaurant in Dublin. Customer reviews say: Best place iGÇÖve ever gone to, the food is absolutely amazing and the customer service is terrific, especially with Krissia, she is very helpful and friendly and i really enjoyed my time here :) | Its taste was better than any other mexican chains in Ireland. It was pretty aggressive service for me, so I thought it might have been trainee but made me surprised that was supervisorGÇÖs service. | Came in with high expectations and left very disappointed.  First off, the portion sizes. Keep in mind I came in the morning, so it's not busy and everything is fully stocked and ready.  I'm not joking when I say I got an actual teaspoon worth of pinto beans and maybe 2 tablespoons of rice on my burrito. I was immediately wondering where on earth the rest of my burrito was.  Next came the meat. Reasonably sized scoop of pork, but given how little rice and beans I got, I asked if I could get a little bit more pulled pork, to which I was told very bluntly I have to pay for that.  At least they were generous with the vegetables, but the very limited selection kind of threw me off - normally any burrito place I go to have twice the amount of options.  Then, the burrito itself. It really wasn't great. The rice and beans were essentially imperceptible, the pork was drenched in a horrendously sweet and artificial-tasting barbaque sauce (yet somehow the meat was still dry), and the overwhelming majority of the wrap was vegetables. Now granted, I got all the veg options on it (of which there are about 4) but ONLY because of how little rice and beans I was given.  The vegetables, like the pork, were also all horrifically sweet. I seriously think they must coat them with sugar.  The wrap was only very lightly warmed, so by the time I sat down and took a bite of the burrito, it was lukewarm at best.  To add to the underwhelming experience, my girlfriend's order of loaded nachos was a similar ordeal. Very light on all the ingredients, even the nachos themselves!  She had been to other Zambreros and gotten the same thing before, and said she had never had a plate that bare.  To top it all off, the issues with the staff. Very disappointed with this place. I was expecting good things since it's located in such a affluent area. Zambrero already stands out for its delicious food and social mission, but with team members like Elton, the experience goes above and beyond. Hopefully they can get their act together because it is a nice hotel. 2 stars for atmosphere only. | During an early spring visit to Galway, we found ourselves at the Ardilaun Hotel, meeting friends amidst warm and blustery weather. Nestled on the hills with the wind from the Bay, the hotel exudes charm. We decided to dine at their Bistro, drawn by its inviting bright wood accents, large menu, fully stocked bar, and an impressive selection of beers on tap.  We started our evening with a variety of drinks: a selection of whiskeys including Hennessy and Jameson, a margarita, a few pints of Moretti, and a glass of Crucero. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable, enhancing our experience as we chatted about the different options available.  For starters, we chose the Indian Dip and Wild Mushrooms. The Indian Dip, reminiscent of hummus, was a delightful mixture of curry spices and coarse chickpeas, served with Naan. The Wild Mushrooms, cooked in garlic butter and parsley, came with sourdough bread and 'rocket' (arugula). These starters were the highlight of our meal, especially the Mushrooms, which were prepared to perfection and could easily be the centerpiece of any meal.  Our entrees included a Steak Sandwich, Thai Curry, Chicken Goujons, Sirloin Steak, and Chicken Supreme. Each dish was a testament to the capable fare of a good hotel restaurant. I enjoyed a well-cooked sirloin with chunky chips, perfectly complemented by my whiskey. The Thai Curry, a vegetarian dish, stood out for its clean finish and rich flavors, while the Chicken Goujons were akin to chicken tenders in the States, satisfying and familiar.  The young, friendly staff added to the pleasant dining experience. After dinner, we relaxed in the hotel's warm and cozy lobby, furnished with cushy chairs and a few intriguing goods to browse. I particularly enjoyed reading about the hotel and their selection of Midleton whiskey. The grounds and gardens of the hotel were in full bloom, adding to the overall charm of our visit.  For anyone seeking a pleasant escape from gloomy weather, the Ardilaun Bistro and the hotel's lobby offer a great way to spend an evening. Starters: For starter we had the loaded potato skins and the garlic mushrooms, both were nicely presented and a suitably sized portion. Both tasted great and would recommend to anyone  attending. Mains: For main course both my girlfriend and myself opted for the beef and chicken fajitas. These were exactly as you expect, severed on a sizzle platter and a generous amount. As with most fajita dishes in restaurants the accompaniments felt a little disproportionate to the meat, however well filled wraps ensure that the three supplied tortillas can be enough, with a little left over, If I was to suggest improvements I would suggest possibly 1 more tortilla and a little larger portion of sauces to ensure there is enough for the amount of filling you receive. Deserts: For desert we opted for the strawberry Eton mess and the chocolate chip cookie jar. Both were great deserts and a suitably sized portion for a third course. Both were presented well, however the "cookie jar" wasn't what you expect with it being served in a glass "bowl" rather than a jar, however this did not take away from it being a nice desert.  Atmosphere: on New years day evening the restaurant was busy however not at capacity. there was a good amount of space between tables a noise level that allowed for easy talking witho

Zambrero Thomas Street is a Mexican restaurant in Limerick. Customer reviews say: Amazing food, amazing staff!! Great vibe in the restaurant! Best place for burrito in Limerick by far... ItGÇÖs very frustrating there is not one good Mexican restaurant around Limerick City bar Republic Grill, even though there not the best either but nothing has topped them yet in my opinion.
